## ValidationErrorX.fromZodError() method

Creates a ValidationErrorX from a Zod error.

Maps Zod's error structure to ErrorX: - Uses first issue's message as the error message - Converts Zod issue code to ErrorX code (e.g., 'invalid\_type' â†’ 'VALIDATION\_INVALID\_TYPE') - Captures all issues in metadata for multi-error handling

**Signature:**

```typescript
static fromZodError(zodError: {
        issues: ZodIssue[];
    }, overrides?: Partial<ErrorXOptions<ValidationErrorXMetadata>>): ValidationErrorX;
```

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

overrides


</td><td>

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional overrides for any ErrorX options


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[ValidationErrorX](./error-x.validationerrorx.md)

ValidationErrorX instance

## Example


```typescript
// Basic usage
try {
  schema.parse(data)
} catch (err) {
  if (err instanceof ZodError) {
    throw ValidationErrorX.fromZodError(err)
  }
}

// With custom message
ValidationErrorX.fromZodError(zodError, {
  message: 'Please fix the form errors',
})

// Access all issues
const error = ValidationErrorX.fromZodError(zodError)
error.metadata?.issues?.forEach(issue => {
  console.log(`${issue.path.join('.')}: ${issue.message}`)
})
```
